formattedAddress: 1 E 55th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1 E 55th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

editorialSummary.text: Handsome American restaurant by designer Ralph Lauren, serving classic dishes, bar bites & drinks.

originalText.text: One of the most coveted restaurants in NYC and rightly so. After all the Instagram hype I started my research and figured out reservations have to be made a month prior by calling only. I called exactly at 10am and was on hold for almost 2 hours but I got through!! They had availability for my desired date at 1030pm. Upon our arrival, we were escorted in by the doormen and seated in front of the bar area. They brought us fried olives, homemade chips and mixed nuts, each item was served warm and fresh. From there they take your drink orders then you are escorted downstairs to the dining area and the entire place is a vibe. We started with popovers and we ordered Caesar salad, vegan burgers, burgers and choc cake for dessert. Best vegan burger I have tried. They have a limited menu but when you are good at what you do you don't need an exhaustive list. The food was extremely yummy and I would definitely go back.

originalText.text:
polo bar is definitely a new york institution, but i was worried it would be overhyped. I LOVED the bar snacks they give you while you‚Äôre waiting‚Ä¶ the fried olives were insane and for that alone, I would go back. The pigs in the blanket were cute, but nothing special. I wouldn‚Äôt order that again‚Ä¶ the burger was a very good, classic burger with nothing fancy. It was nice that they cut the burger for us to share (simple, but a lot of restaurants wouldn‚Äôt do this).

The ice cream sundae was amazing‚Ä¶ totally worth every bite of indulgence. Overall, the meal is fun and the ambiance is amazing- such a vibe and so cozy. The food isn‚Äôt crazy amazing, but overall solid quality but definitely at a high price point. (Drinks are over $20 each.)

originalText.text: Getting a table at this coveted restaurant is a challenge, but the reward is a dining experience that‚Äôs truly worth the effort. The ambiance is enchanting, complemented by exquisite decor and impeccable service. Culinary highlights include a solid burger and a tasty beef sandwich. This place isn‚Äôt just about great food; it‚Äôs a feast for all senses, leaving you planning your next visit before the meal is even over.

originalText.text:
I've been wanting to come here for 7years. The wait list is wild. What's even crazier is the day I went (thankfully I was able to get a reservation a month prior), the place was packed despite a heavy pour that was meant to go through the night. No surprises why. The ambience is incredibly spectacular. Great staff. Amazing selection of the finest of wines and appetizers. It's worth it. Just bummed I don't live in NY area. It's a must-go if you're visiting or live there!!!!!!!

#TeamRL üèáüèáüèá

originalText.text: We came to Polo Bar on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving for dinner before a show. I have always wanted to come here, and I was not disappointed. The upstairs bar scene was incredibly cozy, especially because it was 38 degrees outside. Upon heading downstairs, we were shown straight to our table where our server already knew that we had a show to catch and asked us what time it was curtains up. For dinner I had the chicken paillard which was topped with baby kale and mushrooms. It was light and incredibly satisfying. My husband had the mushroom tortellini topped with black truffles and he said that was also great. Would love to come back when we have more time to spend at dinner and don't need to rush.
